diseases.name: Early Leaf Spot
diseases.solution: To manage these diseases, rotate crops with non-host plants such as cereals, use resistant groundnut varieties, and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil, tebuconazole, or azoxystrobin at the onset of the disease. Improve air circulation by avoiding dense planting and managing weeds, and remove crop residues after harvest to reduce pathogen levels.

diseases.name: Late Leaf Spot
diseases.solution: To manage these diseases, rotate crops with non-host plants such as cereals, use resistant groundnut varieties, and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil, tebuconazole, or azoxystrobin at the onset of the disease. Improve air circulation by avoiding dense planting and managing weeds, and remove crop residues after harvest to reduce pathogen levels.

diseases.name: Rosette Virus
diseases.solution: Control aphid vectors using insecticides like imidacloprid or acetamiprid, plant resistant varieties, and adjust planting times to avoid peak aphid activity periods. Remove and destroy infected plants promptly to minimize virus spread, and consider intercropping groundnuts with other crops to reduce aphid landing.

diseases.name: Northern Corn Leaf Blight (NCLB)
diseases.solution: Use resistant maize varieties, apply fungicides like mancozeb or strobilurins when symptoms are first detected, and practice crop rotation and field sanitation to reduce pathogen inoculum.

diseases.name: Gray Leaf Spot
diseases.solution: Grow resistant hybrids, apply fungicides like strobilurins or triazoles when symptoms are first observed, and ensure good air circulation through proper spacing and field management practices.

diseases.name: Common Rust
diseases.solution: Use resistant varieties, monitor for early symptoms, and apply fungicides if necessary, especially in regions where common rust is a recurring problem.

diseases.name: Wheat Rusts
diseases.solution: Plant resistant wheat varieties and apply fungicides like propiconazole or tebuconazole when rust is detected. Remove volunteer wheat plants and alternate hosts like barberry to reduce inoculum sources, and practice crop rotation with non-host crops.

diseases.name: Septoria Leaf Blotch
diseases.solution: Use resistant wheat varieties and apply fungicides such as chlorothalonil when symptoms appear. Practice crop rotation and remove infected plant debris to reduce pathogen inoculum in the field.

diseases.name: Fusarium Head Blight
diseases.solution: Use resistant wheat varieties and apply fungicides such as chlorothalonil when symptoms appear. Practice crop rotation and remove infected plant debris to reduce pathogen inoculum in the field.

diseases.name: Ascochyta Blight
diseases.solution: Rotate pulses with non-host crops, use resistant varieties, and apply fungicides like mancozeb or carbendazim at the first sign of disease. Ensure good field drainage and avoid overhead irrigation to reduce leaf wetness, which can limit disease spread.

diseases.name: Fusarium Wilt
diseases.solution: Use resistant pulse varieties, rotate crops with non-host plants, and improve soil drainage to prevent waterlogging. Apply appropriate seed treatments to protect seedlings from early infection.

diseases.name: Root Rot
diseases.solution: Improve soil drainage, avoid excessive moisture, and use seed treatments with fungicides like metalaxyl to protect against soil-borne pathogens. Practice crop rotation with non-host crops to minimize pathogen buildup in the soil.

diseases.name: Soybean Rust
diseases.solution: Use resistant soybean varieties and apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or pyraclostrobin when rust is first detected. Monitor fields regularly for early signs of infection, and ensure good air circulation by avoiding dense planting.

diseases.name: Frogeye Leaf Spot
diseases.solution: Plant resistant soybean varieties and apply fungicides such as strobilurins at the onset of disease. Rotate crops to minimize pathogen buildup, and avoid planting in fields with a history of frogeye leaf spot.

diseases.name: Rice Blast
diseases.solution: Plant resistant rice varieties, rotate crops, and apply fungicides such as tricyclazole or azoxystrobin at the early stages of disease. Ensure good water management to reduce humidity levels, which can limit fungal growth and spread.

diseases.name: Bacterial Leaf Blight
diseases.solution: Use resistant rice varieties, avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization, and implement proper water management to reduce disease spread. Remove infected plant residues and maintain field hygiene to minimize sources of infection.

diseases.name: Sheath Blight
diseases.solution: Apply fungicides like carbendazim or propiconazole at the onset of disease, ensure good field drainage, and remove infected plant debris to reduce inoculum levels. Use proper plant spacing to improve air circulation and reduce humidity around plants.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.solution: Apply fungicides such as sulfur or potassium bicarbonate at the first sign of disease, ensure proper canopy management to improve air circulation, and avoid overhead irrigation. Remove infected plant parts to reduce pathogen spread and improve tree health.

diseases.name: Anthracnose
diseases.solution: Use resistant cashew varieties, apply fungicides like carbendazim or copper-based products, and maintain good field sanitation by removing infected plant debris. Prune infected branches to prevent disease spread and improve air circulation within the canopy.
